Assessment of the scale, coverage and outcomes of the Avahan HIV prevention program for female sex workers in Tamil Nadu, India: Is there evidence of an effect?

Thilakavathi S, Boopathi K, Girish Kumar CP, Santhakumar A, Senthilkumar R, Eswaramurthy C, Ilaya Bharathy V, Ramakrishnan L, Thongamba G, Adhikary R, Paranjape R
BMC Public Health, 2011, 11(Suppl 6): S3
Location Tamil Nadu, India
Population FSW
Intervention Description Condom social marketing; peer-based outreach education, promotion and distributionof condoms, establishing program-linked clinics to manage sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and community mobilization
Outcomes

Behavioral Factors: Quality of care

Behaviors: Condom use

Health: Decrease in HIV and STI prevalence
Design Observational
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 4
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 5: Behavior, Customer orientation, Insight, Segmentation, Methods mix

Heading towards the Safer Highways: An assessment of the Avahan prevention programme among long distance truck drivers in India

Pandey A, Mishra RM, Sahu D, Benara SK, Sengupta U, Paranjape RS, Gautam A, Lenka SR, Adhikary R
BMC Public Health, 2011, 11(Suppl 6): S15-S15
Location India
Population Long distance truck drivers
Intervention Description Peer educators, education, clinics
Outcomes

Behaviors: Condom use

Health: HIV and STI testing
Design Observational
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 4
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 4: Behavior, Customer orientation, Segmentation, Methods mix

Rachakulla HK, Kodavalla V, Rajkumar H, Prasad SPV, Kallam S, Goswami P, Dale J, Adhikary R, Paranjape R, Brahmam GNV

Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 4: Behavior, Customer orientation, Segmentation, Methods mix

Increasing safer sexual behavior among Lao kathoy through an integrated social marketing approach

Longfield K, Panyanouvong X, Chen J, Kays MB
BMC Public Health, 2011, 11(872): 1-12
Location Laos
Population Male to female transgender & partners
Intervention Description Peer led IPC; condom/lube social marketing
Outcomes

Behavioral Factors: Improved perceptions of product availability for condoms and water-based lubricant and knowledge about the importance of consistent condom use

Behaviors: Higher levels of condom use at last anal sex with casual partners and greater use of water-based lubricant
Design Observational
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 4
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 7: Behavior, Customer orientation, Theory, Insight, Competition, Segmentation, Method mix

Targeted interventions of the Avahan program and their association with intermediate outcomes among female sex workers in Maharashtra, India

Mainkar M, Pardeshi D, Dale J, Deshpane S, Khazi S, Gautam A, Goswami P, Adhikary R, Ramanathan S, George B, Paranjape R
BMC Public Health, 2011, 11(Suppl 6): S2-S2
Location Maharastra, India
Population FSW
Intervention Description Peer-based outreach education, clinical services for managing STIs, promotion and distribution of condoms, community mobilization and building an enabling environment
Outcomes

Behaviors: Condom use

Health: HIV and STI incidence
Design Observational
Sampling Method Purposive
Strength of Evidence Score 4
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 4: Behavior, Customer orientation, Segmentation, Methods mix

HIV prevention for migrants in transit: Developing and testing TRAIN

Bahromov M, Weine S
AIDS Education and Prevention, 2011, 23(3): 267-280
Location Russia
Population Tajik male labor migrants
Intervention Description HIV education & awareness
Outcomes

Behavioral Factors: Changes in knowledge and worry about HIV/AIDS

Behaviors: Condom use and increased discussion with partner about HIV/AIDS
Design Experimental
Sampling Method Purposive
Strength of Evidence Score 5
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 5: Behavior, Customer orientation, Theory, Insight, Segmentation

Knowledge, stigma, and behavioral outcomes among antiretroviral therapy patients exposed to Nalamdana's radio and theater program in Tamil Nadu, India

Nambiar D, Ramakrishnan V, Kumar P, Varma R, Balaji N, Rajendran J, Jhona L, Chandrasekar C, Gere D
AIDS Education and Prevention, 2011, 23(4): 351-366
Location Tamil Nadu, India
Population ARV patients
Intervention Description Radio-and-theater-based educational program
Outcomes

Behavioral Factors: Higher HIV-related knowledge and lower levels of stigma

Behaviors: Over four times the adjusted odds of asking doctors questions about HIV, greater odds of consistent condom use, improved doctor-patient communication, and peer advice giving and HIV-related advocacy
Design Quasi-experimental
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 5
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 5: Behavior, Theory, Custormer orientation, Insight, Segmentation

Community-based prevention leads to an increase in condom use and a reduction in sexually transmitted infections (STIs) among men who have sex with men (MSM) and female sex workers (FSW): The Frontiers Prevention Project (FPP) evaluation results

Gutierrez JP, McPherson S, Fakoya Ade, Matheou A, Bertozzi S
BMC Public Health, 2010, 10(497): 1-12
Location Andhra Pradesh, India
Population MSM and FSW
Intervention Description Empower KP by improving advocacy within these groups, changing policies that affect these groups, and increasing community awareness. These efforts, combined with the provision of a comprehensive package of prevention interventions implemented on the appropriate scale, aimed to reduce risk-taking behaviours and STI incidence, thereby resulting in a lower HIV incidence
Outcomes

Behaviors: Condom use

Health: Syphilis and HSV bio-marker tests
Design Quasi-experimental
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 5
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 5: Behavior, Customer orientation, Theory, Segmentation, Methods mix

Changes in sexual behaviour leading to the decline in the prevalence of HIV in Uganda: Confirmation from multiple sources of evidence

Kirby D
Sexually Transmitted Infections, 2008, 84(supplement 2): ii35-ii41
Location Uganda
Population Sexually active adults
Intervention Description Condom social marketing
Outcomes

Behaviors: Abstaining from sex; extramarital sex; sex with multiple partners; condom use

Health: HIV prevalence
Design Observational
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 3
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 1: Behavior

Evaluation of a needle social marketing strategy to control HIV among injecting drug users in China

Wu Z, Luo W, Sullivan SG, Rou K, Lin P, Liu W, Ming Z
AIDS, 2007, Suppl 8:S115-22
Location China
Population IDU
Intervention Description Needle social marketing
Outcomes

Behavioral Factors: Exposure to intervention and coverage levels

Behaviors: Needle sharing and condom use with sexual partners

Health: HIV incidence/prevalence and HCV incidence
Design Experimental
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 5
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 5: Behavior, Customer orientation, Insight, Segmentation, Methods mix

Assessing effects of a media campaign on HIV/AIDS awareness and prevention in Nigeria: Results from the VISION Project

Keating J , Meekers D, Adewuyi A
BMC Public Health, 2006, 6(123): 1-12
Location Nigeria
Population Adults
Intervention Description Media campaign
Outcomes

Behavioral Factors: Awareness that consistent condom use reduces HIV risk

Behaviors: Changes in discussion of HIV/AIDS with a partner and condom use at last intercourse
Design Quasi-experimental
Sampling Method Probability
Strength of Evidence Score 5
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 2: Behavior, Customer orientation

Jacobs B, Kambugu FSK, Whitworth JAG, Ochwo M, Pool R, Lwanga A, Tifft S, Lule J, Cutler JR
International Journal of STD & AIDS, 2003, 14: 216-221
Location Uganda
Population Men with urethral discharge
Intervention Description Social marketing of pre-packaged treatment for men with urethral discharge (Clear Seven)
Outcomes

Behavioral Factors: Attitudes

Behaviors: Treatment compliance and condom use

Health: Cure rate
Design Quasi-experimental
Sampling Method Purposive
Strength of Evidence Score 3
Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria 6: Behavior, Customer orientation, Insight, Exchange, Segmentation, Methods mix
